etymology.description: 玫(玫) (méi, "a type of jade") and 瑰(瑰) (guī, "extraordinary; precious") together form the word for "rose". The combination reflects the beauty and preciousness of the flower, akin to valuable jade.
etymology.interpretation: The term 玫瑰 (玫瑰) (méiguī, "rose") evokes the notion of a prized and beautiful object, similar to how jade is valued in Chinese culture, highlighting the rose's elegance and rarity.

examples.chinese: 花园里有漂亮的玫瑰(花園裡有漂亮的玫瑰)。
examples.pinyin: Huāyuán lǐ yǒu piàoliang de méi guī.
examples.english: There are beautiful roses in the garden.

examples.chinese: 我收到一束玫瑰(我收到一束玫瑰)，表达我的情意(表達我的情意)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ shōudào yī shù méi guī, biǎodá wǒ de qíngyì.
examples.english: I received a bouquet of roses to express my feelings.
